Reviews.Title: “Small room is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: TuttoBello
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boulevard Hotel with a friend of mine last year. The location is sensational, and the neighborhood was very safe. I had been traveling in Europe for about a month and a half when I got there, and the size of the rooms was unbelievable. Only one of us could walk in the room at a time, it was SO cramped. The bathroom was tiny, and it was nearly impossible to shave my legs. The staff was clueless half the time, although friendly. In addition, they charged me about $80 just to get a phone line in the room to make a local call. I was upset that I had paid so much for such a disappointing room. Believe me, I had stayed in small rooms but this one was absolutely INSULTING.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Overall, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Excentrique
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend, who was visiting from out of town. Yes, the rooms are small -most hotel rooms in large cities are small. The rooms were very clean (their beds were so damn comfortable), the room was affordable (ask if you can have the triple, it's bigger and the same price as a double), and the location - awesome. I don't regret staying here and actually recommend this place to anyone and everyone. Only problem, they're not handicap accessible, so don't stay if you are unable/unwilling to walk up stairs.

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: lem1Cornwall
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at the Boulevard Hotel, Paddington, and found it to be clean, modern, and well worth the money, which included continental breakfast. A year later we returned to find the hotel in the middle of a takeover by easyjet(everything bright orange) but had not been told this on booking. The room was small, the wardrobe had gone(we were left with 2 coathangers), and everything was bright orange(not for the fainthearted).Also around us were building materials and paint. When we went down to breakfast on the first morning we were told it was not at the hotel but we could have a voucher for McDonalds down the road(not appealing at the best of times). I just feel we should have been told about the refit and lack of breakfast and then we could have made the choice of whether to stay or book somewhere else. The only saving grace were the polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeAwayOnAHoliday
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival to this Hotel I was immediatley dissapointed. The pictures on the website make it look like a Modern Little Boutique Hotel. This is not the case at all. I should have known, the reception staff were rude to me when I called two weeks prior to confirm and I hoped they were just having a bad day but unfortunatley that was just their level of service. There are no elevators so after 30 hours of travelling from Australia we had to carry very heavy suitcases up a flight of stairs with no assistance or even an offer. The room was so small, that I had to get on the bed for my husband to walk past. The bathroom is so small that you can sit on the toilet and brush your teeth over the basin at the same time! All the double decker buses stop outside and passengers were able to look into our tiny little room so we had to close the curtain and unfortunatley the lighting was very bad. I was happy to look past all of this because I was there to enjoy London and really just wanted somewhere clean to sleep, but the service from the staff was so bad, and they were unaccomodating with the few simple requests we had. We were ready to leave after the first night but did not want to loose the money we had already paid. The hotel's cafe was under construction (which we were not advised of) so the choice for breakfast was vouchers to macdonalds or to a 5 star cafe down the street that offered 1 piece of toast, nicely decorated though! Seeing as though we were in London to enjoy this gorgeous city, we had booked early morning tours and the hotel refused to offer us our breakfast vouchers before 7.30am, so we had to get our own breakfast as we had to leave the hotel at 7am. For a depature only 30 minutes earlier they would not offer vouchers or explain why or even try to accomodate. I was so surprised that a hotel in Paddington with so many other hotels and competition in the area would not even try slightly to please us. We loved London and would go back there, but would not stay at this hotel. It is not worth the hassle. It had a great location, but it is still not worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: greaselightening
Reviews.Content: I am just back from my stay in London (23rd -25th June 2008). I was supposed to stay at the boulevard but when we arrived at the hotel we were told by staff that due to water leakage the rooms had to be renovated so we would be moved to a hotel further round the corner. After arriving at the next hotel we were told by staff that we would not be staying there either, so we were moved further again. on arrival at the next place we were told that we would have the BASEMENT room. We decided to look at the room before deciding to stay or not. The bathroom was smaller than the toilet on a plane.NO JOKE. there was no way anyone would have been able to shower in it. To worsen things the room actually had a door leading on to the street. That was the final straw. We then had the task of trying to find a hotel with vacancies which was not easy as it was wimbledon week so everywhere was full. We came across the castleton hotel but unfortunately it was booked up but the very kind manager MARK rang around hotels and found one that could accomodate us for the two nights.Our new hotel was the lancaster court hotel which was 10 times better than that of boulevard. I would definately recommend the castleton and lancaster hotel.perfect location to all the top attractions especially oxford street, marble arch, hyde park. DO NOT GO TO THE BOULEVARD HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: baileymomTucson
Reviews.Content: This place is a rip off. We made the mistake of booking through the hotel websute and it has a non-refundable, non-cancelable policy for any reason including a family death! We booked on the basis of positive reviews from this website. Big mistake! Impossibly small room - my husband was able to stand and touch both walls (average size man). No way to wash your face without sitting on the toilet. Noise all night long on the stairs and a porn shop on the corner. We were unable to open my suitcase and stand on the floor at the same time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could have done better”
Reviews.Author: Mire84
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights, and was not very happy in the end, as for almost the same price you can go to Chrysos. The rooms are extremely small, but comfy. The furniture is quite old, and the mattress is very puffy. Next to the bed was a small "bar" where surprisingly was a coffee machine, but never used it. The bathroom is more than small, and if you are claustrophobic, better try another hotel. The air van from the bathroom would go on for more than 15mins after you turned off the light (imagine this after a long day of walks around town and shopping). With regards to the breakfast, I could say there was almost none. I usually don't eat in the morning, but my boyfriend does and he would make me go on a little adventure to McD. After breakfast (which surprisingly is Continental breakfast - and I've never seen a continental breakfast so insufficient). The stuff doesn't speak very well English (though it may sound strange cause you're in London), but in the end you manage to make yourself understood. The good thing with this hotel is that is very close to Paddington station, and in front of the hotel there is a small park. You also have an Indian Cuisine restaurant next to the hotel's entrance that I suggest you don't go to very often though the food is ok, but they will make you pay more than you would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & cosy”
Reviews.Author: MrsDeary
Reviews.Content: The photos on the hotel's website are quite misleading, especially the reception which was unrecogniseable from the photo. However, after reading reviews before our trip we were prepared. Despite the bedroom and shower room being very small, which was sufficient for three nights, we found the room to be confortable, warm and very clean. The towels were changed and the room cleaned every day, which was great and the young male receptionist was helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a great location. We didn't have breakfast but presume it's still in the cafe around the corner as there is no breakfast room at the reception, where there is building work going on. We found this hotel to be good value for money and played a large part in a very enjoyable stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY - trust me”
Reviews.Author: lotsoftravel08
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE. The photos on the website are nothing like what the actual hotel is. Small rooms - I am 5'9" and I could easily reach one side of the room with my hands and one side with my feet. You can barely fit in the bathroom and there is no room for luggage. The breakfast was horrible and the staff barely spoke English. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny But Ok”
Reviews.Author: Shan-Oz
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Boulevard Hotel for 2 nights in early February 2008. The hotel is very close to Paddington station, which was very convenient. It is also close to Hyde Park, Oxford Street and other attractions. When we first walked into the reception we realised that it was not a very big hotel and we had some trouble with our 2 large suitcases in the reception area. There is no elevator in the hotel so we had to lug both of our 20kg suitcases up 4 flights of stairs. The hallways are also tiny - 2 people can't walk together side by side. Our room? Well, I think the word small is not really appropriate - tiny maybe closer to the truth. We had trouble opening 2 suitcases at once, it was basically impossible to do. There was a double bed in the corner and almost directly next to the bed was the door to the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in my life! We could not fit the two of us in the bathroom at one time - it was just too small. Having said this, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean, and as we didn't spend much time in the room while we were in London, the size wasn't much of an issue for us. If we had've been staying for longer, we would have asked if they had any bigger rooms. The room also had a TV with lots of channels to choose from. The reception area is also the breakfast area and is not very big. They would have trouble if more than 10 people came down for breakfast at once. The breakfast was included in our room cost, and consisted of cereal, yoghurts, bread and a selection of fresh pastries, which were nice and tasty. Staff were friendly at breakfast and happy to serve you hot drinks. If you are fit, I would recommend walking from the hotel to the tourist destinations in the area. There is alot to see along the way and the hotel is close to some local attractions. As we had a late departure from London, the hotel were good enough to hold our bags for us - but we did have trouble fitting them into the room at reception!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but very nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: JackieJaxx84
Reviews.Content: These rooms were pretty small but they were still very nice for the price. Everything was freshly renovated and all the furniture and electronics were new. The "breakfast" you get at the cafe down the street isn't anything more than just tea and some toast. The service was good and everyone at reception was extremely friendly. It is pretty close to a metro stop which was nice because it isn't close to any major attractions. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Change to breakfast”
Reviews.Author: snowdrop5
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on the 17th February 2008. This hotel currently has building work going on and there is no breakfast room. When you go down to reception in the morning you are given breakfast vouchers and directions to a restaurant. We had expected a continental buffet breakfast, what we got was "help yourself" vacuum flasks of hot water and coffee (various teabags also provided) and a plate each with one slice of toast cut diagonally into two and a warm crumpet. Butter and pots of jam are on the table. My partner is diabetic, so we had to purchase extra food, as this wasn't enough for him. This arrangement seems quite new, so it could be teething problems, but the restaurant service was very slow, so bear that in mind, if you have business meetings to attend. Hotel room was clean, although the floors in rooms and corridors are laminate, which produce a lot of extra noise that carpets would have deadened.

Reviews.Title: “It's O.K. but..........”
Reviews.Author: deadeggs
Reviews.Content: We have just spent our third stay at this hotel. This is how it stands at the moment. We are people in the hotel industry and try to be fair on both sides. Our stay NÂ°1 was just after the refurbishment and reopening about 4 years ago. Taking into account the small rooms and bathrooms, our stay NÂ°1 was O.K., even though the hand basin and shower leaked. One year later, stay NÂ°2, was bad. Walls were badly marked and dirty, hand basin and shower leaked (not the same room), bed linen was worn out and they had done nothing about the general wear and tear. We said 'never again'. So why stay NÂ°3 ? We got the impression that they had tidied up the place and had put double glazing on the windows (the hotel is on a busy street and bus route). From their promotions, we picked up a good price for our four day stay. I had promised myself that if it was like our second stay, it would be check-in and straight away check-out. For our travels we only use hotel rooms for sleeping as we are avid tourist and spend all day and half the night out and about. We found on stay NÂ°3 (Jan 08) that it was O.K. They have made efforts and appear to be making efforts to keep the standards up (two star level). Our shower leaked again and after asking for two days, they finally gave us a sheet to put on the bathroom floor so that we didn't have to stand in water. We had forgotten about the size of the rooms. WARNING We don't recommend this hotel for people over 80 kgs (220 pounds). People above that weight will have problems using the bathroom and passing in the room. We are in the region of 70 kgs (220 pounds) each and we have to work out a plan to pass one another in the room. Think of a camping car and that will give you an idea of the size of the room and bathroom. We travel light but if you have more than one suite case plus hand luggage, you'll have no room left in the room to move. Positive side of the hotel ....location, price (if negociated) dÃ©cor that is modern and a pretty good continental breakfast which is included in the room rate. If you are over the weight we quoted, explain and see if they can help you with a room a few inches bigger (or take two rooms). I think the size of the bathroom/s will be the same. We may stay there again, but we won't if we can find something better for the price and in the same location (a very difficult task in London). The breakfast and housekeeping staff have always been super. Management and reception are not quite up to the same standard.

Reviews.Title: “good but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: rodgehenley
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel. Clean and contemporary but begining to show wear and tear. Blinds don't work shower leaks bedding getting a bit tired and stained. Come on guys it was great when you first opened but I feel your getting lazy and just taking the money. You need to lick it back in to shape. I'd still stay there but please don't take the P....

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: enjoytheearth
Reviews.Content: I recently had an overnight layover in London: my husband booked a single for me at the Boulevard while I was out of cell/i-net access range so I didn't have any idea of what to expect. The Boulevard is very easily accessible in its location near Paddington Station: I arrived late in the evening and felt safe walking alone through the area. I was very pleased with the room, regardless of its compact size. The floors and built-in closet/desk/coffee shelf were a bright light wood. The bed was uuber comfy as was the plush comforter for the chilly night (the window was right next to the head of the bed and there was a little draft). The bath was very clean and cute, and both the hairdryer and the small flat screen tv hanging at the foot of the bed were bonuses. Before heading back to Heathrow on the Express (which was also very handy), I was able to enjoy a quick croissant, juice & cappuccino (included in the room price) in the hotel's simple lobby/cafe. I plan on trying the Boulevard again on a future visit to London. I was very impressed with the hotel considering its economic price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dippy3
Reviews.Content: We paid a really reasonable rate for this room in comparison to other 3* hotels in the same area. The hotel is small and the rooms are really compact but they make the most of the little space with really modern furnishings.The shower was the best ever, really warm and powerful! They do have hairdryers in the room but they're not that good, so if really need one take your own.It's an all no smoking hotel, so you can't smoke in your room either.Breakfast is basic (toast, cereal, croissant) but more than enough to start you off. The hotel is really close to paddington station and underground, so no need to get a taxi. There's an off liscense near by that sells everything, a few pubs ( beware they stop serving at 11pm on the dot) and lots of places to get food right on the doorstep. On our departure day, they let us leave our bags behind reception whilst we made the most of our last few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsKenneth
Reviews.Content: Amazing value for money from this fantastic little hotel. Just returned from a two night stay. The hotel was situated in a fantastic location approx 2 mins from Paddington station. They let us keep our bags their on our final day which was a massive plus. The only reason I wouldnt give this place five out of five is the fact its right by a bus stop so a little noisy. The rooms are tiny but extremely clean. Will definately be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: karumen
Reviews.Content: We, two singles (late-20s/early-30s), booked a 6-night stay in a standard double room at the end of Sept '07. The Boulevard Hotel is in an undeniably fabulous location 2 min from Paddington Stn but, sadly, that is all there is to recommend this closet-sized dump. THE ROOM A steep, three-flight climb up the narrow staircase found us in a room no larger than a prison cell. Immediately to the right of the room entrance is the bathroom, in which one has about 2 ft sq. to manoeuvre. The sink was so small (1 ft wide) that I couldn't wet my face without also wetting my feet. The glass shelf over the sink was placed so that a false move could bring your forehead crashing into it. The drainage in the sink was so poor that you could only leave the tap on for about 15 seconds before it filled up, after which you had to wait 5 min for it to drain. The shower stall was standard, but water leaked onto the floor. Without a bath mat or towels other than a bath towel to mop it up, this presented a bit of a problem. Moving into the room, one finds a double bed. The space beside the bed is just wide enough for one standing suitcase, as is the space at the foot of the bed. The vanity is in a little alcove to the left. CLEANLINESS The sheets on the bed seemed reasonably clean, though the mould near the bottom of the shower stall was a little worrisome. We didn't look in or use the kettle provided, but used one of the spoons for a chocolaty dessert one evening. We left it well away from the mugs so that the staff would know that it had been used. Imagine our disgust when we pulled the spoon out from the mug to use the next day and found sticky chocolate on the tip of the spoon. The cleaning staff also repeatedly left the shower dripping after tidying the bathroom so that we would return to the room to find water splattered all over the bathroom floor. When a call was made to reception, the staff member merely handed me a towel, with no apologies and no offer to mop the floor for me. THE HOTEL Twice, our key stopped working on the door. The second time I made the three-flight journey to the reception desk to have it reset, the staff member greeted me with, "Oh, let me guess, your key isn't working." "Yes," I said, "how did you know?" "Oh, it happens all the time. Our security system is reset every day." "Isn't that somewhat of an inconvenience?" "It's for your own security." I asked him to set it so that I could keep opening my room door for the duration of my stay, which he did. Clearly, the hotel can set an expiry time on cards; why not set it for the day you check out? There is zero soundproofing on the room doors. Indeed, all fellow travellers could be heard in the hallways, their doors opening and closing sounding as if it were your own. The bathroom door was not large enough for the door frame, allowing sounds to be heard from in there, too. It needs to be mentioned that on our second night, the hotel's fire alarm system malfunctioned, causing the alarm to sound 6 times between 3:30 am and 8:30 am. The alarm consists of a siren that sounds for 30 seconds before all of the lights in your room are turned on. The night staff failed to call the alarm maintenance people during the night because "they wouldn't come anyway." Neither compensation nor apology was offered. I have put up with small inconveniences in my stays in various hotels throughout Europe, Asia, Australia, and North America. Never have I come across such indifferent staff. It was the staff members' complete unwillingness to help to take an extra step that sets this hotel apart from the many that I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend.”
Reviews.Author: cooler_king1981
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the room was still dirty and in a state of disarray from the previous occupants (bed unmade etc) and we had to wait at reception while they hastily made the room up. The room itself accommodated little more than the bed and nothing else. When we discovered the head of our electric toothbrush had been broken by hotel staff we advised reception that day and had to chase for most of our stay to get it replaced. They weren't interested, despite it being - by their own admission - their fault. They were reluctant to shell out the paltry Â£7 for replacement heads and we had to hang around an extra hour when checking out while the rude staff went out to purchase replacements for us (rather than just give us the money to do this ourselves!). The situation resembled pulling teeth rather than cleaning them! The only thing the hotel had going for it was its price and location very close to Paddington station and underground.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: my3gifts
Reviews.Content: very good place. value for money in london. in london for this price you simply can not do better. small room but modern, wood floors, lcd tv with sky, nice breakfast. great great great staff. request a non smoking room as mine smellt a bit of smoke but this hotel is a must in london on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mike4176
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel the lady at the front desk noticed there was no single rooms in the back of the hotel available. She then gave me a double in the basement. My first night was terrible since I could hear footsteps from the restaurant above me. The next day they moved me to a single room on the third floor. I must say the room was very quite spacious for a single compared to other hotels that I stayed in London. There was plenty of room to walk around in the bathroom as well as inside the room. The room also had a closet to store your clothes. The entire hotel is clean and looks brand new. There is a 24 hour front desk attendant which will provide you will all guest services. One flaw is the a/c does not work at full speed. I had to take off the filter to feel the air. The hotel is not 100% perfect. But for $100 a night in the center of London you get a spacious clean room with a comfortable bed, a/c, friendly service, and a full strengh shower with 24 hour hot water. I travel every year to London and compared to all the other hotel at Norfolk Square and Sussex Gardens, this seems to be the best bargain. One tip- this hotel faces a busy street with ongoing buses. Therefore request a room in the back of the hotel and stay away from the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value and location”
Reviews.Author: sunshine205
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good value hotel close to Paddington station and bus routes into central London - this this is an excellent choice. I stayed here with my 5 year old and we felt very safe and well looked after by the supeb staff. The rooms are exactly as the web site - modern and clean. They are very small but if just want a bed for the night then the rooms are warm comfy and clean. We stayed at the front - our choice ,which was a little noisy ( bus stop outside) so would stay at the back next time. Breakfast was a bonus we didnt expect for the price and was good. Would definately go again and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a cupboard this is just for you”
Reviews.Author: DonaldLondon
Reviews.Content: This building is a series of Â£90 a night cupboards not a hotel. The rooms are tiny. At best it's just manageable for one night. Book a double for one person and don't expect to unpack. In fact if you take a big case expect to either to leave it outside or be prepared to sleep on it..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mrspain
Reviews.Content: This hotel the best in London.....i stay other hotel always this is first time in hotel boulevard staff help me a lot..they gave me and my girl friend free londoan maps....help us booking tours 24 hour reception and very friendly staff always willing to help guest and i felt like i was home....so comfortabe they help me making phone to my brother and tell me how to make call using cheap calling card newly refurbish.....excellent location 2 mins talk to station nice and safe area.....can walk to hyde park and oxford street.....24 hours bus access i will surely go there again and again

Reviews.Title: “Very small room and even smaller bathroom but charming!”
Reviews.Author: cheryllow
Reviews.Content: Great location for the price - 5 minute walk to Paddington station which is a convenient line for shopping district and airport link. Everything about the hotel is compact and there are no lifts - our room was the smallest I have ever seen where we could touch both walls with arms outstretched but the bathroom was even tinier so your forehead touches the washbasin when you are on the toilet! The laminated flooring also proved to be annoying as it was very creaky. There is alot of noise from both the street (all rooms face the street and there is a bus stop outside the hotel - our window could not fully shut) and the hotel corridor. However breakfast was lovely with fresh croissants, Danish pastries, cornflakes and hot chocolate. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise -- pneumatic drill from 9 am!!”
Reviews.Author: wayardtourist
Reviews.Content: There was really noisy construction next door when I stayed (laye August 2006) -- so you can forget about slepping past 9 am! And it looked like it was a long-term project. Also hotel staff disorganised and called me at 8:30 am to ask me when I was checking out. I have stayed at two nearby hotels called Norfolk Towers and Royal Norfolk and found them to be better than Boulevard -- don't be fooled by included breakfast: it's not much. Only plus at Boulevard is AC -- in case it's really hot.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only a couple of nights and our room was the smallest I ve ever been into,with a single bed which apparently there is called "twin"!The sheets and towels werent changed everyday as it is common and overall the room gave the impresion of dirty.The breakfast was quite poor with 3 slices bread butter jam coffe or tea orange juice and corn flakes,definitely not worth waking up at 8 for it. Anyways the staff was friendly and helpful.It was not very expensive and you get what you pay for but I ve certainly found better hotels for the same price or even less in London. For sure I aint gonna stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Duck into the Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: Topher202
Reviews.Content: I had done a fair amount of online research in advance of my one-night stop over in London and was glad to have discovered the Boulevard. My criteria: a low-priced, reasonably comfortable lodging in close proximity to Paddington Station (and the Heathrow Express). I am happy to report that the Boulevard hit all the right notes. My 3rd floor single was just 50 pounds for the night (booked about 5 weeks in advance online) and it met all of my needs very nicely. Yes, the bedroom was quite small and the en suite bathroom was closet-like, but the spaces were well-designed and tastefully decorated. I slept okay, despite some moderate street noise (ear plugs recommended if you're a light sleeper like me). The room did not have any instructions regarding a wake-up call nor was there an alarm clock, so I set the alarm on my cell phone and that sufficed. Good thing, since I needed to catch a 5:30am-ish Express train to LHR. This was easily accomplished since the hotel is just 5 minutes walk from Paddington Station (from the right front entrance of the station, walk straight ahead to either platform 6 or 7; the Express ticket kiosk is right there and the trains leave every 20 minutes to Heathrow from 5:10am on). The neighborhood was decent and had I stayed in town any longer, I'd have likely explored the tree-lined residential area surrounding the hotel and the shops and food options nearby on Praed St. In summary, the Boulevard was ideal for one night, especially given that I was a solo guest, traveling light. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Give Boulevard a go!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SparklySJ
Reviews.Content: Boulevard Hotel was perfect for a few nights stay! The breakfast was nice, with tea/coffee and orange juice, cornflakes and lots of toast with butter and jam. The rooms were on the small side, but clean, and the TV was ace! Great location, friendly staff and clean rooms made for a pleasant budget stay. Would book another stay with Boulevard, and I am hard to please!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As budget hotels go this one was pretty good. The room, although small, was modern and demonstrates a clever use of space as every nook and cranny was used for something. The bathroom, yes it is very small but clean and it had a great shower. The breakfast was ok, you cant really go wrong with toast and cornflakes though! My only problem was one day we returned to our room and the sheets had not been changed, or the bed made for that matter. They had been in the room as the duvet was thrown over the bed and new towels left sitting on the bed. All in all a good value hotel and at Â£160 for 3 nights in a great location, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Clean”
Reviews.Author: CincyMom
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Boulevard Hotel from July 15-18. We booked earlier this year & confirmed via email with no problems. We were in Rm 101, a large double, that had a decent bed, a/c, a circulating fan, hair dryer, and the tiny bathroom that would make an airplane proud. Everything was clean when we arrived & cleaned each day. Breakfast from 8 - 9:30 was simple, but filling: cornflakes, toast, juice, tea/coffee. Every room has a flower box, which was a nice touch. The neighborhood was quiet with lots of small hotels along Norfolk Square. Praed St. had several pubs, Indian restaurants, shops, and St. Mary's Hospital. The walk to Paddington Station was a quick block away -- getting on & off the Tube (Bakerloo Line & others) was simple & painless! This was a good value for the money & we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fleas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were covered in flea bites for days. They got into our luggage and we had to wash everything we own and spray our apartment when we got home. This hotel is filthy, DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, gross, disguesting. Please Read.”
Reviews.Author: microskis
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is that when we arrived and pulled back our sheets at night, someone had clearly had sex on the bed (their were stains and public hair). No one had changed the sheets. We had to go downstairs, get new sheets, and change them ourselves. Considering this place is about $120 a night USD, I was having a heart attack. Horrible, small, the location isn't anywhere you'd want to hang out, all you do is take the metro to other places in London. I feel that London in general is a hard place to find a decently priced hotel on the USD and get your money's worth by any stretch of the imagination, but this was ridiculous, nearly ruined the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay...”
Reviews.Author: sjdunham
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice in the same week - there two days, gone two days, back for three days. Although I'd booked singles both times, the first time they put me in a "small double", which they let me have because I wanted a room off the street. The second time I got a single, also in the back of the hotel away from the street. (A choice I definitely recommend if you can get it: the noise difference between the front and back of the building is substantial.) The rooms are, um, cozy even for one person in the "small double," but perfectly functional if you just need a reasonable place to sleep. Each has its own air conditioner. I don't think anyone's told the staff that they need to clean the filters once in a while, though - I hosed down one set in the shower and afterward the box blew about three times as much air. :-) Turning the mattress helped with sleeping comfort - the "foot" end was higher than the "head" end, so I turned it around (no small trick in a single-sized room!) and remade the bed. Rooms come with towels and tiny soap bars: no flannels (washcloths) and no shampoo - bring your own. Housekeeping was OK - I certainly wouldn't describe the hotel as "dirty" at all. Noise from adjacent rooms is noticeable but not obnoxious, which is no surprise in a budget hotel. Norfolk Place is on several great bus routes - coming back from contral London the 15 bus drops off right across the street from the hotel, and going toward the center picks up right around the corner. (Norfolk is a one-way street...) Breakfast was corn flakes, white toast, tea or coffee, and orange juice of a sort. Perfectly decent, and the staff is very helpful. I thought the area was fine - lots of restaurants and pubs, newsagents, Paddington station nearby, etc. Edgware Road and Oxford Street are an easy walk, as is Hyde Park. The day I left I got up at 0450, was on the Heathrow Express from Paddington at 0510, and inside security at Terminal 3 by 0550. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very small & dirty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, and we must say, our room and our bathroom were the smallest one in the world. It wasnÂ´t very clean and the sheets were broken... The location isnÂ´t bad.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe One of the Best Bed & Breakfast in London”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my friend for 4 nights just a week ago. We booked one double bed at 51.00 GBP per night at special discount rate. Room: As many other people said, it was definately not the big - Yes it is indeed small or very small. The bathroom is also very small. The bed is big enough to sleep for 2 adults. The room was decorated as IKEA style - moden. The room was clean and was provided new towel and bedding sheets everyday during our stay. Facility: Room has *coffee/tea maker (but we never used because the kettle was too dirty to use) *hairdryer *flat screened TV (which had at least 20 channels) *wardrobe *air-conditioning (it was not working maybe it was April when we stayed) *shower/toilet (shower was very powerful and was able to get hot water anytime) Breakfast: We only had breakfast 1st morning. The breakfast was very very simple- 5 slices of toast (for 2 adults) and jam/butter, a glass of orange juice, a cup of coffee/tea. But there was also some cereal (optional). Staff: Friendly and helpful. Reception was open for 24 hours. Location: 5 minutes walk from Paddington Station. There were many restaurants nearby area - American, Chinese, Greece, Indian, Korean, Fish & Chips, KFC, etc.... In overall, I would recommend people to stay this B&B. I guarantee that you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy”
Reviews.Author: ardana1
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Boulevard in June 2004. I found it to be a convenient location. While the room was small, it contained everything necessary for comfort - including air conditioning- and the room was immaculate. Everyone on the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: prettyladylala
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Europe, the Boulevard Hotel was a delightful and comfortable place to stay. Our rooms were tiny, but manageable. My sister and I were looking for an affordable, safe place to stay, and we found one at the Boulevard Hotel. The rooms were clean, except for the comforter, with which we never used. The bathrooms were also clean, but very small. We did have a problem with our shower, but the staff fixed the problem that morning and everything was fine. But you do have to worry about the hot water at times. The best thing to do is take a shower at night or early in the morning, preferably before 7:30 am. The rooms have air condition and quite a selection of tv channels, which was fun to fall asleep to. Because the hotel is located in an accessible location for buses and the tube, there is noise from outside. That actually wasn't too much of a problem. We slept with the window cracked open, but the noise was not too bad. Also, all transportation was within walking distance, and we never had a problem with waiting for a bus for too long. The continental breakfast was also lovely. It was a light, but filling breakfast, and to be included in the price of the room, it was a great price. I do have to say that we miss the jam and the orange juice...they were really good. And overall, the staff were excellent. They were kind, accommodating, personable, and overall pleasant. We would definitly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: ruthlesswood01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boulevard for 5 nights this summer, and had a great experience. Yes, the rooms are TINY, but since we spent most of our time out on the town, we weren't bothered by the limited space. We especially liked the location - about a minute walk from Paddington Station, and with lots of fast food and grocery stores nearby. Our room was clean and tidy, and the staff was accomodating & friendly. London is an expensive hotel town, and it was nice to find a safe and affordable budget option. My one and only complaint is that buses rumble right past the hotel all day and night. The solution? Get a room facing the back, or wear earplugs like I did.

Reviews.Title: “A good value London hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an enjoyable 4 night stay in a small double at the Boulevard in June 2004. Yes, the room was small - but that's to be expected in London. It was clean, comfortable and well-furnished. The bed was comfy, and the sheets clean. Blonde wood furntiure with flatscreen TV gave the place a modern / contemporary air, contrary to the "Ye Olde England" decor that most London hotels aim for. Our room was relatively quiet, as we were away from the front. However, that meant the view from our window was straight into the room across the way. Just remember to close the curtains before you undress! The ensuite bathroom is, as others described, little more than a closet. A little acrobatics is required to move around in there. But it was newly tiled, clean and functional. The aircon unit in our room had been removed for some reason. In it's place was an ill-fitted piece of concrete. Thankfully it wasn't too hot while we were there so we had no need of it. Otherwise, it just took away from the overall charm of the room. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and the front desk is staffed 24x7. Breakfast was quite decent consisting of juice, toast and tea/coffee. Location was superb just a few minutes stroll from Paddington Station, and numerous buses around the corner. A pub and fish & chip shop across the road. Some lovely Indian restaurants around the block and an internet cafe about 20 metres up the road. All up, a nice hotel at a great price for London. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pipaya
Reviews.Content: We had booked in advance and had confirmation with venere.com for two large double rooms, but when we arrived the hotel had no reservation for us, and after a 24hour flight that's not what you want to hear! The hotel did the best they could, but that consisted of two tiny rooms. On the upside the rooms are very clean and the location is great! Overall great value for money in London! Just remember to check reservation a few days before!! Also, the Frontline cafe a couple of doors down from the hotel has good food. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: LucyEllen
Reviews.Content: I also read the review before my stay in the hotel for a night on September 11 2004 but i did not believe that the bathrooms could be quite that small! the bathroom in my parents caravan is bigger! but the room was very clean and nicely decorated with a 'new / clean' smell about it. We were given a large double as there was an error with our booking, so now i can see why the americans slated the rooms so much, if you are larger than average then you will probably feel extremely claustrophobic. I would definately recommend it for a cheap short stay, after all you cannot expect a palace for such a cheap price! The location was brilliant, only a 10 minute walk to Hyde Park. Staff friendly too and are really flexible with check in times

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend. I read the reviews b4 going but still didnt think the rooms would be so bad. I was wrong!!! The rooms are TINY!!!. The only good thing about the hotel is that the rooms are nicely decorated and its in an excellent location! We got there over an hour early but they still let us check in. When we got in our room there was hair all over the floor and even in the bed!! We had a small double but the room was nowhere near big enough for 2. You cant move in the bathroom, its like a aeroplane toilet! The sink is so small you can barely manage to wash your face in it! If your thinking about staying here I definately recommend you book a large double(im not sure how much bigger this would be!). Also request a room at the back of the hotel as the noise at the front is terrible, it keeps you awake all night!(its a 24hour bus route) I would recommend you stay here if your looking for a cheap and basic hotel that your NOT planning to spend alot of time in>

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two weeks with my boyfriend. I was in the large double room, and it wasn't so large! It was very very little, but nice, with a great television and optimal AC! The shower was the only big place in the room! Unfortunately for two days there wasn't hot water, there was a problem that suddenly has been resolved. It was enough clean, even if one day they forgot to enter in our room, without cleaning. The only really bad thing was that they ever change our sheets, in 15 days... Breakfast was ok, bread with butter and jam, tea, coffee, milk, chocolate (don't take chocolate, it's terrible!), cereals and orange juice. The hotel is very well located, just 5 minutes walk from Paddington station and Tube. This hotel is cheap and nice, a rare thing in London.

HotelInfo.Name: Boulevard Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 10 Norfolk Place | Bayswater, London W2 1QL, England
